record.title: ORDER OF PROCEDURE

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, we will speak as in morning business for 10 minutes and if the Chair would let me know when I have a minute left.

Mr. President, reserving the right to object, and I certainly would not object, but I want to understand the time. We have a vote at 4 o'clock, I believe, which is already ordered. Would the President tell me what the time is between the two parties, how it is divided and who controls time at this point?

record.chair: The time for morning business has been equally divided until 4 o'clock. The Republicans have no time remaining, and the majority has 33 minutes.

speaking.paragraph: Senator Kennedy is asking for 10 minutes in morning business?

record.chair: Senators are permitted to speak for 10 minutes.

speaking.paragraph: Might I ask to follow Senator Kennedy in morning business for 10 minutes?
Mr. President, reserving the right to object, if that is where we are.

Mr. President, could I have the attention of Members. I understand the good Senator from Kansas wanted to make a brief statement about the terrible tragedies that have affected his State, and I see my friend from Vermont is here, so if he were to take 10 minutes, we would still have 10 minutes.

I am wondering if Senator Sanders would be willing to take 6 minutes and let Senator Roberts have 4 to talk about the tragedies in his State. He mentioned this earlier to me, and I didn't think we would have this time dilemma. Would that be acceptable?
I could not hear the amount of time I might be permitted.
We have the whole 30 minutes, but the Senator from Vermont has said that, of his 10 minutes, he would be glad to yield to you 4 minutes, and then he will take 6 minutes. Would that be agreeable?
If I could plead with the Senator for 5 minutes?
I thank the Senator from Vermont.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I will yield 1 minute of my time to Senator Sanders.

record.chair: The Senator from Massachusetts is recognized.
